content: Service A is a critical microservice that processes customer orders. It depends on Process X for order validation and enrichment. Service A runs on containerized infrastructure with auto-scaling capabilities.
title: Service A Architecture Documentation

content: For Service A incidents and outages, the primary escalation point is Team Y. They can be reached via email at team-y@example.com or through the on-call rotation at +1-555-0100. Response SLA is 15 minutes for P1 incidents.
title: Service A Runbook - Escalation Procedures

content: Service A uses Database Z as its primary data store. All customer order data is persisted in this PostgreSQL database. The connection pool is configured with a maximum of 100 connections.
title: Service A Data Architecture

content: Process X is invoked by Service A through a synchronous REST API call. The process validates order details, checks inventory, and enriches the order with customer preferences from the CRM system.
title: Process X Integration Guide

content: Team Y owns and maintains Process X. They are responsible for monitoring, updates, and performance optimization. The team meets weekly to review process metrics and plan improvements.
title: Process X Ownership and Responsibilities

content: Critical Service A failures require immediate escalation to Team Y. Common failure scenarios include database connection issues, Process X timeouts, and memory exhaustion. The runbook provides detailed troubleshooting steps for each scenario.
title: Service A Failure Scenarios

content: Database Z is maintained by Team Y with daily automated backups and weekly maintenance windows. The database runs on Azure Database for PostgreSQL with high availability configuration and automatic failover.
title: Database Z Maintenance Guide

content: Service B calls Service A for order processing operations. The integration uses REST APIs with OAuth 2.0 authentication. Retry logic is implemented with exponential backoff to handle transient failures.
title: Service B to Service A Integration
